intro: Blakea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an epiphyte or on rocky outcrops, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
